meanings.definition: A unit of time in prosody, equivalent to the time taken to pronounce a short syllable.
meanings.sent1: The teacher explained that a morae is the time it takes to say a short sound.
meanings.sent2: She counted the morae in each line of the poem to understand its rhythm.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the actor comically exaggerated the morae in his speech.
meanings.sent4: The morae of the ticking clock seemed to slow down as the exam approached.
meanings.sent5: The morae of each heartbeat echoed in the silent room.

meanings.definition: A delay or pause in a process or activity.
meanings.sent1: After a brief morae, the meeting resumed with new energy.
meanings.sent2: The traffic jam caused a morae in their journey to the airport.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected morae in the presentation made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His decision to take a morae from work was like hitting a reset button.
meanings.sent5: The morae in communication led to misunderstandings between them.
